title: Demolition in Doosan borchure.
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405003056im_/http:/typophile.com/files/DemolitionInDoosanBrochure_3656.jpg)
  
This is a generic sans -- I don't care which one -- with special treatment to represent demolition.  
I find the restrained treatment to be more effective than the customary extreme defacing of a font.  
I got it from a Doosan heavy equipment brochure. It also showed more words with the same treatment, which I did not get.  
I would appreciated any pointers as to the font name.  
I know it's not the one in a previous Demolition thread:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/84703](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405003056/http:/typophile.com/node/84703 "http://typophile.com/node/84703")  
It did not spot it in a Google image search for "fonts demolition" or at  
 [http://lava360.com/attractive-distorted-fonts-free-download/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405003056/http:/lava360.com/attractive-distorted-fonts-free-download/ "http://lava360.com/attractive-distorted-fonts-free-download/")  
Don
author: donshottype

comments.content:
This one is very close if not matching to [Uptown](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405003056/http:/www.dafont.com/uptown.font) by Anthem Type.  
More in the same vein: [Impacted](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405003056/http:/www.dafont.com/impacted.font), [Rock's Death](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405003056/http:/www.dafont.com/rocks-death.font), [Raw](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405003056/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/device/raw), [You Are Loved](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405003056/http:/www.dafont.com/you-are-loved.font), [Mr Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405003056/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hipopotam/mr-black), [Dead Kansas](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405003056/http:/www.dafont.com/dead-kansas.font), [Letterpress](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405003056/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/facetype/letterpress) Headline, [Dirty Bag](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405003056/http:/www.dafont.com/dirtybag.font)  
Having a look to some sections at DaFont could be helpful too, full of eroded post-treatment, most of time very well executed: [Fancy \> Eroded](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405003056/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=107), [Fancy \> Destroy](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405003056/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=109).  
Best one so far for your 2 requests is [Rust Bucket BA](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405003056/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/rust-bucket) by Bob Alonso.

Thank you Ryuk. As far as I can see Uptown is almost a match.  
I also like Impacted and some of the effects in Mr. Black and Rust Bucket.  
Followed your link to DaFont's Destroy theme & during my journey through 56 pages of many ways and degrees of destruction I did find a font with some applicability to the shell hole concept in my other request: Malevolentz.  
Don
